name: Vietnamese Fish Sauce Fried Chicken Wings (Cánh Gà Chiên Nước Mắm)
description: Crispy Fried chicken wing with a fine outer crust, tossed in a sweet fish sauce glaze. For those who are absolutely terrified of the smell of death coming from a bottle of fish sauce, this is the perfect recipe to overcome that fear and baby step your way into the magical world of Vietnamese and Southeast Asian cuisine.
keywords: fish sauce fried chicken, Vietnamese fried chicken recipe, fish sauce, ga chien nuoc mam, Vietnamese fish sauce fried chicken wings, Vietnamese fish sauce chicken wings, fish sauce chicken wings, how to make Vietnamese fish sauce chicken wings, Vietnamese fish sauce wings, Vietnamese fish sauce chicken wing recipe, cánh gà chiên nước mắm, fried chicken with fish sauce, Vietnamese fried chicken wings with fish sauce, Asian fried chicken recipe, Asian fried chicken, Asian fried chicken recipe with fish sauce, cánh gà chiên, nước mắm, canh ga chien nuoc mam, gà chiên nước mắm, ga chien nuoc mam

video.name: Vietnamese Fried Chicken Wings (Cánh Gà Chiên Nước Mắm)
video.description: Vietnamese Fried Chicken Wings (Cánh Gà Chiên Nước Mắm)

recipeInstructions: Marinate chicken with garlic powder, salt, ground black pepper, and chicken bouillon powder for at least 30 minutes.
Coat marinated chicken wings with cornstarch. Tap off excess.

Heat vegetable oil in a large tall skillet to 350°F. If you don't have a thermometer, drop a bit of cornstarch into the oil. If it starts to sizzle without burning quickly, oil is ready. Deep fry chicken wings in batches, about 8 minutes per batch or until golden brown. Transfer chicken to a wire rack to drain off excess oil.

In a small saucepan make the fish sauce glaze: heat fish sauce, sugar, lemon juice, and water until sugar is fully dissolved and the mixture comes to a small boil. Turn off the heat and allow the sauce to cool to slightly thicken. Toss chicken and sauce (a little at a time to your liking) in a large mixing bowl. Transfer chicken to a platter and serve immediately.
